org.hps.readout.util.collection

Class LCIOCollectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hps.readout.util.collection.LCIOCollectionFactory

  • public class LCIOCollectionFactory
extends Object
    Class LCIOCollectionFactory is responsible for instantiating LCIO collection parameter objects. It allows all of the relevant parameters to be set, at which point one the two methods produceLCIOCollection(Class) or produceManagedLCIOCollection(Class) may be called to generate the actual object.

    Note that ManagedLCIOCollection objects are used by the ReadoutDataManager and generally should not be instantiated by users. LCIOCollection collection class is intended to be defined by ReadoutDriver objects for use in either outputting on-triggered or defining their output to the readout manager.
    See Also:
    LCIOCollection, ManagedLCIOCollection

    • Method Detail

      • cloneCollection

        public static final <T> LCIOCollection<T> cloneCollection(LCIOCollection<T> baseParams)
        Clones an LCIO collection parameters object. If a parameter is defined in the factory, that parameter will be used for the new cloned object. Otherwise, the parameter value from the argument object will be used instead.

        This method is intended to be used to create a new instance of an LCIO collection parameters object with a new parameter value.
        Parameters:
        baseParams - - The set of default parameters.
        Returns:
        Returns a new LCIO collection parameters object with the same parameter values as the original, unless specifically defined in the factory beforehand.

      • produceLCIOCollection

        public static final <T> LCIOCollection<T> produceLCIOCollection(Class<T> objectType)
        Creates an LCIOCollection from the parameters set in the factory. The following parameters are used for this object type:
        • Collection Name
        • Production Driver
        • Flags
        • Readout Name
        Of these, the collection name and the production driver are required and, if not set, will generate an exception.

        The collection parameters object will be parameterized as per the input class type argument.

        Note that all parameters are reset automatically after a collection parameters object is generated.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - The type of object stored in the collection.
        Parameters:
        objectType - - The class type of the objects represented by this collection.
        Returns:
        Returns an LCIO collection parameters object with the specified parameters.

      • produceManagedLCIOCollection

        public static final <T> ManagedLCIOCollection<T> produceManagedLCIOCollection(Class<T> objectType)
        Creates an ManagedLCIOCollection from the parameters set in the factory. The following parameters are used for this object type:
        • Collection Name
        • Production Driver
        • Flags
        • Readout Name
        • Persistent
        • Time Displacement
        • Window Before
        • Window After
        Of these, the collection name, the production driver, and the time displacement are required and, if not set, will generate an exception.

        The collection parameters object will be parameterized as per the input class type argument.

        Note that all parameters are reset automatically after a collection parameters object is generated.
        Type Parameters:
        T - - The type of object stored in the collection.
        Parameters:
        objectType - - The class type of the objects represented by this collection.
        Returns:
        Returns an LCIO collection parameters object with the specified parameters.

      • setCollectionName

        public static final void setCollectionName(String value)
        Sets the name of the collection. This must be unique for each collection.
        Parameters:
        value - - The collection name.

      • setFlags

        public static final void setFlags(int value)
        Sets the LCIO readout flags for the collection. Flag definitions can be found in the LCIOConstants class.
        Parameters:
        value - - The LCIO flags.

      • setGlobalTimeDisplacement

        public static final void setGlobalTimeDisplacement(double value)
        Defines the amount of time between when an object is created within the simulation and when its originating truth data was seen.

        This parameter only applies to managed LCIO collections, and will have no effect otherwise.
        Parameters:
        value - - The time displacement for the collection.

      • setParams

        public static final void setParams(LCIOCollection<?> params)
        Sets all factory parameters which are not already defined to the values of the argument LCIO collection. Parameters that are not valid for the argument collection remain undefined unless manually altered.
        Parameters:
        params - - The source parameters object.

      • setParams

        public static final void setParams(ManagedLCIOCollection<?> params)
        Sets all factory parameters which are not already defined to the values of the argument LCIO collection
        Parameters:
        params - - The source parameters object.

      • setPersistent

        public static final void setPersistent(boolean state)
        Sets whether or not a managed collection should be persisted to LCIO on a trigger event or not.

        This parameter only applies to managed LCIO collections, and will have no effect otherwise.
        Parameters:
        value - - true means that the collection will be written to LCIO, and false that it will not.

      • setProductionDriver

        public static final void setProductionDriver(ReadoutDriver driver)
        Defines which driver is responsible for producing the collection.
        Parameters:
        driver - - The production driver.

      • setReadoutName

        public static final void setReadoutName(String value)
        Specifies the readout name for the collection. This is used to obtain meta-data and other information about the geometry that is associated with a collection object.
        Parameters:
        value - - The readout name for the collection.

      • setWindowAfter

        public static final void setWindowAfter(double value)
        Sets a custom time window after the trigger time in which collection objects will be written out into data. If not defined, the default readout window and trigger offset values will be used instead.

        This parameter only applies to managed LCIO collections, and will have no effect otherwise.
        Parameters:
        value - - The time window length in nanoseconds.

      • setWindowBefore

        public static final void setWindowBefore(double value)
        Sets a custom time window before the trigger time in which collection objects will be written out into data. If not defined, the default readout window and trigger offset values will be used instead.

        This parameter only applies to managed LCIO collections, and will have no effect otherwise.
        Parameters:
        value - - The time window length in nanoseconds.

      • reset

        public static final void reset()
        Resets all factory parameter values to undefined. Note that this is done automatically after an LCIO collection parameters object is generated, and does not need to be called manually.

      • verifyBaseCollectionParameters

        private static final String verifyBaseCollectionParameters()
        Checks that all of the parameters needed to define a basic LCIO collection are in fact defined.
        Returns:
        If all parameters are defined, null is returned. Otherwise, a String is returned containing an error message.

      • verifyManagedCollectionParameters

        private static final String verifyManagedCollectionParameters()
        Checks that all of the parameters needed to define a managed LCIO collection are in fact defined.
        Returns:
        If all parameters are defined, null is returned. Otherwise, a String is returned containing an error message.
